parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go up, mount, ascend; of things: I rise, spring up, come up. From ana and the base of basis; to go up.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A mountain, hill. Probably from an obsolete oro; a mountain: -hill, mount(-ain).

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To call to myself, summon. Middle voice from pros and kaleo; to call toward oneself, i.e. Summon, invite.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and erchomai; to go off, aside or behind, literally or figuratively.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
